title: Pajama Guardians? Why wouldn't you just make them chromas?
body: I don't get it. It just feels like you guys couldn't find literally any other champion who needed the skins more? I own all the SG skins so it's a little confusing who is your target?

replies.body: It's a blatant moneygrab, the skins are the exact same as the SG skins but with minor changes. Truly disgusting.
So, they make more skins, you can buy either and have no obligation to do so. What's the issue?

They basically duplicated a skin line and made minor changes to it. The efforts put into that could've been put into champions that are in more dire need of skins instead of champs like ezreal who have 11 skins lol

that they're most likely replacing ACTUAL Star Guardian skins this year maybe?????
By that logic, every skin that is not a Star Guardian skin is replacing a potential Star Guardian skin.
yes, because every skin is an alternative star guardian skin released around the same time of year the real Star Guardians would be released lmao

We've got two batches of star guardian skins, so now it's supposed to be an annual thing??

Come on, we've got 10 of them already, that's more than most skin lines…

Yes, just like PROJECT, and Dark Star, and all the other skin lines they release new skins for around the same time every year. It would be really stupid of them to cancel one of their most popular skin lines in the same year they're outed as a piece of shit company internally.

And yet, Dark Star only has 7 skins (if you consider Rhaast as one), and PROJECT has 12, only 2 more than Star Guardian for 3 batches instead of 2.

Star Guardian already has plenty, and there is only so much Riot can do. The Leona skins must have been very long to make, and the **_5_** Pajama skins are nice to have while not requiring much less work than fully new Star Guardians.
HOW DARE Riot try to make money in the only way they can through this game! It's not like you can just not fucking buy them!

Honestly I feel like the concept is fine(giving us different versions of skins for a cheaper price if you own the regular skin already),but I feel like only getting a -30% discount for a skin that is very similar to one that you already own is honestly not enough,it should be at least -50%(though I guess you can combine it with the regular skinsale,I wonder how the reductions would stack).

EDIT: Was wrong about the recalls,they still have a different model though and thus I'd agree with Broken Fangz,that 750 would be a fine price if you already own the star guardian skins.
Prestige Edition skins are also pretty similar in concept to Variants.

Yes, though the only prestige was done for 2500 tokens and possible to return as a Gemstone skin since it is in the Mythic category.   So would you rather see Gemstone skin variants that can cost $1000s just to get or a skin at 1350 that is a different variant?
I wouldn't rather either; I don't need to get both Variant skins if I like only one of them.  I'm definitely not getting both Variants of the Leona skin.

The Pajama Guardian skins (the ones that the OP is complaining about) actually don't have different recalls at all. They are literally just a different model. Which should be discounted to 750 if you already own the original skin, if you take into account the current pricing rules for 750 skins. (just a different model, no new anything else)

If it turns out that they have different particle effects when they hit the PBE then I would understand the discount they have as of now, but from just the reveal video anything other than 750 is a ripoff.

Yeah I agree that the price reduction isn't enough(and 750 seems like a fitting price),I just think the concept is overall ok,since it allows Riot to make cheaper skins with the particles of more expensive ones.

Yes, but we didn't know that then.  They are still 1350 worth skins, they come with different models, effects and sounds when compared to the base champion. So they aren't going to be sold for any less.  With the discount though they are now 742  as it's now been increased, so if you own one version you can get the other for much less.

The price discount is fine, I won't be touching them and I don't personally want to encourage this from Riot. That's just my take on it, whoever enjoys these skins, good for them. They might be skins with different particles and models from the base, but that doesn't change the fact that they were half the effort from Riot being sold for ultimately the same price. I'm incredibly disappointed that instead of just waiting for a new SG team we got rehashed skins with unoriginal particles and recalls.

Are we really that surprised that a Popstar Ahri 2.0 skin is followed by SG 2.0 skins? People are buying them, and it's a lot easier and more profitable to keep tweaking existing skins for popular champions than it is to make entirely new skins with different themes for unpopular champions. One day, this game will consist of nothing but Ahri, Lux, and Jinx mains fighting over who gets first pick... but at least they'll each have a hundred "unique" skins to choose from.
